Literature Review: The COVID-19 pandemic has had a profound impact on financial markets, leading to unprecedented volatility and disruption. This introductory article provides a comprehensive review of the five articles published in this issue of the Annual Review of Financial Economics, which explore various aspects of the COVID-19 crisis. The articles examine the effects of the pandemic on financial stability, household behavior, and fixed income markets, among other topics. This literature review aims to synthesize the existing research on the COVID-19 pandemic and its impact on financial economics.
